sentences: Noah Gale, professionally known as Ro Ransom, is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, and record producer from Manhattan, New York.
He is currently signed to Same Plate Entertainment and Sony Music.
He had a breakthrough hit with his 2016 single "See Me Fall".
His most recent project, an EP entitled Possessed, was released in September 2018.
Noah Gale was born in Queens, New York and grew up in the Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan.
He wrote his first rap in sixth grade and began releasing music at age 15 in 2008 using the stage name Nero.
In 2011, Gale began using the stage name Ro Ransom to avoid confusion with an EDM group also named Nero.
In 2012, he released a remix of the Purity Ring song "Odebear".
In 2013, Ransom released several songs, including "No Fucks Given" (using an Eminem sample), "Forgiveness", "Lesbian Girl" (using an Aaliyah sample), and "Ebony & Ivory".
In August 2015, he released the single "See Me Fall" (featuring Kensei Abbot) which would go on to become a breakthrough hit for Ransom.
He released a music video for the song that December, and a remixed version by Y2K came out in March 2016.
Throughout 2016, Ro also released several other tracks including "Talk Too Much", "Donuts" (featuring Kensei Abbot), "Invented Swag" (featuring Kensei Abbot and Nessly), and "Doppelgänger".
Early in 2017, he opened for Dua Lipa on her first North American tour.
In October 2017, he released a mixtape called Momentum while on tour with Connecticut rapper Witt Lowry.
It featured the aforementioned "See Me Fall", "Prettiest", and "Doppelgänger" as well as the single "Prettiest" featuring Jazz Cartier.
In April 2018, Ransom released the song "Floetry" (featuring Kensei Abbot), which was his first single to be released on Same Plate Entertainment, a joint venture label with Sony Music.
In June of that year, he released the single "Wraith", a song influenced by 1990s R&B acts like TLC and Destiny's Child.
In September 2018, Ransom released his first and only project with Same Plate/Sony, the EP Possessed.
